Feedback:
Thank you for taking the time to submit your application and for expressing interest in joining the team. We appreciate your effort and the qualities you mentioned, such as empathy, honesty, and integrity — all of which are valuable traits for any staff member.

After reviewing your application, we’ve decided not to move forward at this time. Many of your responses were very short and lacked the level of detail we look for when evaluating candidates. Your answers didn’t provide enough background or explanation for us to fully understand your goals, experience, or how you would handle various staff situations. When applying, it’s important to give full, thought-out responses that show both your understanding of the role and how you would contribute to the team.

We did appreciate that you mentioned reporting Supervisor issues to a Lead Supervisor — that’s the correct action and shows a good sense of responsibility. However, overall, your responses need more depth, structure, and clarity. We also recommend working on spelling and grammar to improve communication, as this is an important part of being a staff member.

We encourage you to take some time to better familiarize yourself with how our staff team operates, provide more detailed answers, and reapply when you feel ready. With more effort and explanation, you could be a stronger candidate in the future.
Blacklisted due to use of AI.

Thank you for taking the time to apply and for expressing interest in joining the New England Transit staff team. We appreciate your effort and the experience you’ve shared from other communities.

After reviewing your application, we’ve decided not to move forward at this time. While your responses showed enthusiasm and prior staff experience, many of your answers lacked the depth and structure we look for in successful applications. A number of responses were focused more on personal details or general statements rather than directly addressing how you would handle specific staff duties or situations here at NET.

We also recommend focusing on providing clearer, more concise answers in the future, as communication and professionalism are key parts of the Supervisor role. Additionally, while it’s great that you were invited by a current staff member, we’d like to see more emphasis on your own motivations for joining the team rather than being influenced by others.

That said, you clearly understand basic moderation concepts such as professionalism, escalation, and fairness — which is a great foundation. With more attention to detail, stronger explanations, and a clearer understanding of our team’s expectations, you could be a stronger candidate in the future.

We encourage you to take some time to improve your application quality and reapply when you feel ready. Thank you again for your interest and continued support of New England Transit.
